project.teaser: WelFarmers will set up eight national innovation networks and four Europe-wide networks of pig farmers, advisors, veterinarians and researchers to address the challenges of the upcoming change in the European pig welfare legislation. WelFarmers will address four main topics:...
project.objective: WelFarmers will set up eight national innovation networks and four Europe-wide networks of pig farmers, advisors, veterinarians and researchers to address the challenges of the upcoming change in the European pig welfare legislation. WelFarmers will address four main topics: cage ban; keeping pigs with uncovered tails; avoiding pain during castration and space and flooring. The most urgent innovation needs and challenges will be identified in a bottom up way and the network will collect and evaluate good practices that meet these needs. WelFarmers will also strive to collaborate with existing and new EIP-AGRI operational groups (OGs) and EU research projects focused on pig welfare and to enhance their impact. The selected best practices will be disseminated through a series of communication and dissemination activities to reach most pig farmers in the eight participating countries and in Europe. EIP abstracts, thematic reports videos, brochures, e-news, national workshops, transnational cross-fertilisation events and a multilingual website are some of the dissemination methods planned to communicate and disseminate the best practices.
project.title: EU Farmers’ Pig Welfare Innovation Network
project.keywords: Animal Welfare, Pig production, Best practice, Environmental sustainability, Economic sustainability, Participatory process, Sharing information, Network, Communication, Dissemination, EIP AGRI Groups

article.title: Revolutionising pig farming with best practices

result.title: List of good practices and Top 5 candidate for best practices – Round 1 (Theme 2)
result.description: Document including the list of the 24 good practices collected by the RNs and those voted as top 5 best practices for Theme 2, undocked tails, in the 1st round of the WelFarmers contest.

result.title: List of good practices and Top 5 candidate for best practices – Round 1 (Theme 4)
result.description: Document including the list of the 24 good practices collected by the RNs and those voted as top 5 best practices for Theme 4, Space allowance/flooring, in the 1st round of the WelFarmers contest.

result.title: Guidelines for analysis of good practices and collection of impact data
result.description: Document including all the methodology and recommendations that RNs and TGs need in order to collect, describe and assess the good and best practices in each one of the Themes.Deliverable common for WP 2, 3 ,4 and 5

result.title: List of collaborating EIP-AGRI OGs, TNs, Cost Actions, EU research projects and RDP projects
result.description: Document including all the OGs, TNs, COST actions and R&I projects contacted by WelFarmers and the description of the collaboration established with each one.

result.title: Literature review on space allowance / flooring (Theme 4)
result.description: Literature review in the format of peer-review publications including state of the art in space allowance and flooring.

result.title: Literature review on avoiding tail docking (Theme 2)
result.description: Literature review in the format of peer-review publications including state of the art in raising pigs with undocked tails.

result.title: Sustainabillity plan
result.description: Document describing the path for exploitation of the results during and beyond the project.

result.title: Ethics Mentor report
result.description: Document describing any ethical issues that arise during the development of the activities of the project and how these are handled by the consortium partners.For this project the ethics mentor will be Laura Boyle from Teagasc.

result.title: List of good practices and Top 5 candidate for best practices – Round 1 (Theme 3)
result.description: Document including the list of the 24 good practices collected by the RNs and those voted as top 5 best practices for Theme 3, castration, in the 1st round of the WelFarmers contest.

result.title: Communication, dissemination and exploitation plan
result.description: Document produced following the guidelines available for Horizon projects to describe in detail the communication and dissemination actions within the project including channels and targeted audiences.

result.title: Literature review on castration avoidance (Theme 3)
result.description: Literature review in the format of peer-review publications including state of the art in castration for pigs.

result.title: List of good practices and Top 5 candidate for best practices – Round 1 (Theme 1)
result.description: Literature review in the format of peer-review publications including state of the art in raising pigs with undocked tails.

result.title: Literature review on farrowing systems (Theme 1)
result.description: Literature review in the format of peer-review publications including state of the art in loose housing systems for sows.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
